newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: ATHLETICS-PEREZ AND STANKINA TAKE WORLD CUP TITLES.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-PEREZ AND STANKINA TAKE WORLD CUP TITLES.

text.p: Ecuador's Olympic 20 km walk champion Jefferson Perez added to his gold medal collection by winning the World Cup over the same distance on Saturday.
Perez moved away from the rest of the seven-man group who entered the final two-km lap together to win in a national record one hour 18 minutes 24 seconds and take the $20,000 first prize.
China's Mingjun Tan and Mexico's Bernardo Segura crossed the line in second and third place but were both disqualified.
Mexico's Daniel Garcia and Russia's Ilya Markov were eventually presented with the silver and bronze medals, clocking 1:18:27 and 1:18:30 respectively.
Russia took the men's 20 km team title with Belarus second and Mexico third.
Russian Olympiada Ivanova set off at world record pace in the women's 10 km event but began to tire after the halfway mark.
She was overtaken by her compatriot Irina Stankina at 7,500 metres and the reigning world champion strode away to win in 41 minutes 52 seconds.
Ivanova hung on for second in 41:59 with China's Gu Yan third in 42:15.
Russia took the women's team gold medals with Italy second and China third.
